notes: Canonical named locations of Coffin Canyon.
All named locations explicitly include full location-type variables.
Values are resolved from type_ref plus authored narrative intent.
State effects are NOT auto-applied; these are final authored stats.
coffinCoughChance is retained for environmental systems.

locations.name: Gore Mule Drop
locations.description: A steep rail drop where engines scream and brakes turn to prayer. The stones are stained in the shapes of old wrecks.
rumors: You can hear a train that never arrives if you stand here at dusk.
Something drags wreckage into the ravine to build a nest.
Rail crews leave offerings in grease to keep the grade quiet.
notes: Travel choke point. Escalation-ready ambush terrain.

locations.name: Lost Yots
locations.description: A wrong-way crossing full of misleading tracks and half-buried markers. People swear the land re-arranges itself.
rumors: Maps copied from maps turn poisonous here.
A traveler can walk in a circle and come out days older.
The markers were placed by someone who wanted you lost.
notes: Navigation pressure zone. Great for pursuit / evasion.

locations.name: Santoâ€™s Grin
locations.description: A cracked saint-face carved into stoneâ€”half chapel, half warning. Candles burn even when no one lights them.
rumors: If you pray for mercy here, something answers in a voice you recognize.
A Shine Rider once tried to rob the offerings and never blinked again.
The grin grows wider after blood is spilled nearby.
notes: Spooky Mexico flavor. Excellent for bargains, curses, confessions.

locations.name: Tin Flats
locations.description: A hard, flat spread of discarded metal and busted rail goods that rings like bells when the wind comes through.
rumors: The flats hide a buried boxcar nobody can open twice.
Rust here moves like ants when the moon is thin.
Thereâ€™s a â€˜cleanâ€™ path acrossâ€”if you donâ€™t mind paying.
notes: Loot terrain. Great for scavenging pressure + ambush cover.

locations.name: Sangr
locations.description: A dry arroyo with red-stained stone that looks wet even in full sun. The name was misspelled once and stuck forever.
rumors: The cut floods with something that isnâ€™t water when the canyon â€˜turns.â€™
Old prayers in bad Spanish are carved under the overhangs.
Blood dries slower here. Sometimes it doesnâ€™t dry at all.
notes: Violent travel lane. Good for chase scenes and sudden hazards.

locations.name: Splitglass Arroyo
locations.description: A tight-cut ravine glittering with sharp stone like broken bottle-glass. Sound carries wrong and returns in pieces.
rumors: Gunshots here come back as different calibers.
A man can whisper at one end and hear it answered from behind him.
Something nests where the glass shines brightest.
notes: Ambush canyon. Echo and sound tricks encouraged.

locations.name: Bandit Buck
locations.description: A half-legit rail stop where freight slows down and trouble speeds up. Bandits, deputies, and monsters all know the schedule.
rumors: The stop was named after a man who robbed the same train twice.
A â€˜ghost freightâ€™ passes through without stoppingâ€”unless it sees you.
Someone here sells keys that open locks you donâ€™t own.
notes: Scenario ignition point. Great for timed arrivals, heists, standoffs.

locations.name: Tzulto
locations.description: A crater with a temple inside itâ€”Tzul stone that doesnâ€™t weather right. The air feels â€˜heldâ€™ as if the place is still listening.
rumors: The crater wasnâ€™t formed by impactâ€”it was removed.
Certain words spoken here come out in a different voice.
Monsterology has a map of this place they refuse to share.
notes: High danger landmark. Lore anchor. Thyr-rich.

locations.name: Kraise
locations.description: An old claim district named from a misspelled surname that nobody corrects anymore. Deeds change hands, but the ground doesnâ€™t care.
rumors: The original Kraise is buried somewhere in the markers, still holding the first deed.
If you steal here, your footprints appear ahead of you.
A â€˜perfectâ€™ vein is rumoredâ€”always one shovel deeper than anyone digs.
notes: Legal conflict zone. Great for debt, claim jumping, and betrayals.

locations.name: Mindshaft
locations.description: A field of working and abandoned minesâ€”dark mouths laid out like a grid. People come back with ore and leave with fewer thoughts.
rumors: Miners here dream the same dream on the same night.
Something hums when Thyr is nearâ€”like a tuning fork inside your skull.
A shaft exists that only opens when someone lies.
notes: High pressure, high reward. Strong monster / Thyr interactions.

locations.name: Pallor
locations.description: A bleached stretch of earth where color seems to drain out of people. Even blood looks wrong against the dust.
rumors: Photographs taken here come out blank except for teeth.
A traveler can lose their shadow for a day.
The ground tastes like chalk and old sermons.
notes: Mood shift zone. Great for dread, hallucinations, and heat pressure.

locations.name: Widowflow
locations.description: The river that River City serves, fears, and measures. It takes more than it gives and sometimes returns things that shouldnâ€™t be returned.
rumors: The Widowflow runs uphill on certain nights.
If you speak a name into the water, it answers in bubbles.
A ferryman works this river who never steps onto land.
notes: Major lore artery. Excellent for rituals, crossings, disappearances.

locations.name: Fool Boot
locations.description: A boot-shaped rock formation used as a waypoint and a warning. The smart pass by. The foolish camp.
rumors: Someone always leaves a boot hereâ€”no one admits itâ€™s theirs.
Shots fired near Fool Boot attract things from far away.
The rock â€˜pointsâ€™ a different direction after storms.
notes: Waypoint landmark. Great for rendezvous, betrayal, omen scenes.

locations.name: Grade Grind
locations.description: A punishing incline where engines labor and freight slows to a crawl. Everyone watching knows exactly how long youâ€™ll be exposed.
rumors: A train once stalled here and never moved again.
Someone keeps replacing the same broken signal lamp.
Bandits wonâ€™t attack on Thursdays. No one knows why.
notes: Tactical choke. Great for timed pressure and long exposure.

locations.name: Crackpits
locations.description: A field of fractures and sudden pits where the ground sighs and lanterns gutter. The land opens without warning and closes without apology.
rumors: A crack here leads to a chamber that smells like a lit church.
People fall in and come out speaking politely to nobody.
Monsterology pays good money for soil taken from the deepest pits.
notes: High danger terrain. Strong atmospheric hazard + horror hooks.

locations.name: Martygrail
locations.description: A relic site of contested faithâ€”half saint story, half canyon trick. People leave prayers and take curses by mistake.
rumors: A cup exists here that fills only for the unworthy.
The site â€˜movesâ€™ a few yards after every killing.
Somebody keeps repainting the same symbol even after rain.
notes: Excellent for cult pressure, relic hunts, and moral bargains.

locations.name: Heckweed
locations.description: A spread of angry scrub that tears clothes, hides burrows, and makes every step feel like a mistake.
rumors: Heckweed grows thicker where someone lied.
A â€˜cleanâ€™ trail appears sometimesâ€”then vanishes.
Creatures here leave no tracks until you look away.
notes: Low-supply friction zone. Great for survival pressure and stalking monsters.

locations.name: Fort Plunder
locations.description: Liberty Corps stronghold at the northern mouth of Coffin Canyon. Rail-controlled, procedural, and lethal by design.
rumors: A sealed rail tunnel beneath the fort leads to something the Corps refuses to map.
Officers stationed here are rotated early because of recurring nightmares.
Uncle Liberty has been sighted here exactly once.
notes: Controlled danger. Escalation-ready.

locations.name: Diablo
locations.description: A vast, lawless sprawl at the canyonâ€™s southern end. Smoke-choked streets, rotbuck deals, pit brothels, and monsters sold on stage.
rumors: The city is built atop a buried Dust King temple that still feeds it power.
Monsters refuse to enter Diablo unless driven or wounded.
Every Shine Rider gang has betrayed someone here.
notes: Always booming. Volatile equilibrium normalized.

locations.name: Camp Coffin
locations.description: Monster Rangers headquarters built atop a forgotten Tejas town. A hard sanctuary where monsters are neighbors, not resources.
locations.atmosphere: Uneasy peace held by tired veterans
rumors: Thyr behaves differently inside the camp walls.
A monster elder advises the Rangers in secret.
Monsterology has tried and failed to destroy Camp Coffin three times.
notes: Safest known location in the canyon.

locations.name: The Laboratorium
locations.description: Monsterologyâ€™s primary research complex. Cages, vats, engines, and things that should not be alive.
rumors: Something intelligent is kept alive in the lowest level.
Mort from this site tastes different.
The complex is built on pre-human ruins.
notes: Prospering, unstable, ethically compromised.

locations.name: Silverpit
locations.description: An active mining wound carved into the canyon wall. Ownership changes violently and often.
rumors: The deepest shaft opens into something that breathes.
A monster nests inside the ore itself.
Silver from Silverpit curses hoarders.
notes: Violently contested asset.

locations.name: Fortune
locations.description: A crossroads settlement that survives by staying useful and pretending neutrality.
rumors: The town council sells information to every faction.
A buried rail line runs under the main street.
Nobody in Fortune sleeps well.
notes: Information economy hub.

locations.name: River City
locations.description: A settlement clinging to the Widowflow. Life is cheap. Water is not.
rumors: The river changes depth overnight.
Something answers if you speak to the water.
Entire crews vanish mid-crossing.
notes: Water is power here.

locations.name: Plata
locations.description: High-altitude silver camp balanced on narrow ridges and bad luck.
rumors: A hidden vein of pure Thyr lies above the camp.
Miners hear singing from sealed tunnels.
No one buried here stays buried.
notes: Hard to supply. Easy to lose.

locations.name: Cowtown
locations.description: Ranch land built atop ancient monster grazing grounds. Livestock thrives unnaturally well.
rumors: The cattle are not entirely mundane.
Monsters mark the land but do not attack openly.
Every herd has a favored animal.
notes: Predators are tolerated until they are not.

locations.name: Ratsville
locations.description: A shantytown built from scrap, desperation, and bad luck. No law holds.
rumors: Ratsville sits atop a collapsed mine full of bones.
The town moves slightly each year.
Something protects it for unknown reasons.
notes: Migratory ruin.

locations.name: Ghost Mountain
locations.description: A wind-scoured massif riddled with old tunnels and signal fires.
rumors: Lights answer each other across impossible distances.
A hidden observatory crowns the peak.
Climbers age faster on the ascent.
notes: Landmark-scale danger.

locations.name: Deerhoof
locations.description: A quiet highland settlement and monster refuge beyond the canyon rim.
locations.atmosphere: The land watches how you walk
rumors: The spirits guide the respectful and ruin the careless.
Monsters shelter here without fear.
No blood spilled here ever dries.
notes: Protected by custom, not walls.

locations.name: Huck
locations.description: A remote frontier stop used by scouts, smugglers, and canyon runners.
rumors: Maps bought here are never fully accurate.
Someone in Huck tracks every traveler.
The outpost has been rebuilt in the exact same spot four times.
notes: Transient population hub.

locations.name: Dustbuck
locations.description: A trade town grown fat on livestock drives and canyon spillover.
rumors: Some cattle walk themselves to market.
Dustbuck brands appear burned into bones miles away.
The town prospers when Coffin Canyon worsens.
notes: Decay feeds profit.

locations.name: Bayou City
locations.description: A swollen river-mouth city where canyon runoff meets the coast.
locations.atmosphere: Where the canyon leaks into the world
rumors: Bodies travel upstream at night.
The water listens if spoken to softly.
Some ships refuse to leave once docked.
notes: Major river-city spillover zone.
